intro: Eclipta oederi, commonly known as the blue daisy, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composite, consisting of both ray and disk florets, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eclipta oederi is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
